## Base modal
A simple modal with just header, close button and body. It has an option to add a leading icon before the header. There are no action buttons. Clicking outside has the same effect as clicking on the close button.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My base modal"
        >
          <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Cursus metus aliquam eleifend mi in nulla posuere sollicitudin aliquam. Massa tincidunt nunc pulvinar sapien et. Ut lectus arcu bibendum at varius. Ut etiam sit amet nisl purus in mollis nunc. Suspendisse in est ante in nibh mauris.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Action Modal
A modal that also has built in primary and secondary actions, that have already been positioned appropriately to follow UX and design guidelines and best practices.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My action modal"
          kind="action"
          primaryActionButton={<Button className="beautifulButton">Primary</Button>}
          secondaryActionButton={<Button>Secondary</Button>}
        >
          <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Cursus metus aliquam eleifend mi in nulla posuere sollicitudin aliquam. Massa tincidunt nunc pulvinar sapien et. Ut lectus arcu bibendum at varius. Ut etiam sit amet nisl purus in mollis nunc. Suspendisse in est ante in nibh mauris.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Action Required Modal
A modal where the user must make a choice before proceeding. It does not have a close button. Clicking outside has no effect.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My actionRequired modal"
          kind="actionRequired"
          primaryActionButton={<Button onClick={this.closeModal}>Primary</Button>}
          secondaryActionButton={<Button>Secondary</Button>}
        >
          <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Cursus metus aliquam eleifend mi in nulla posuere sollicitudin aliquam. Massa tincidunt nunc pulvinar sapien et. Ut lectus arcu bibendum at varius. Ut etiam sit amet nisl purus in mollis nunc. Suspendisse in est ante in nibh mauris.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Onboarding Modals
A modal that has a dedicated image space, a heading, and body copy. There is a "cover" that introduces the concept, and a "flow" with "n" number of "steps".

### Onboarding Modal - Cover
An onboarding modal that does not display the progress indicator text or the secondary action button. The primary action button can be used to display the onboarding steps.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My onboarding cover modal"
          kind="onboardingCover"
          primaryActionButton={<Button>Learn more</Button>}
          onboardingHeaderImage={<Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Cover+Image" alt="Meaningful alt text" />}
        >
          <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Onboarding Modal - Step
An onboarding modal that displays the progress indicator text. Primary and secondary action buttons can be used to navigate forward and backward through the onboarding flow.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My onboarding step modal"
          kind="onboardingStep"
          primaryActionButton={<Button>Next</Button>}
          secondaryActionButton={<Button>Previous</Button>}
          onboardingHeaderImage={<Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Step+Image" alt="Meaningful alt text" />}
          onboardingStepCurrent={2}
          onboardingStepTotal={5}
        >
          <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Creating an Onboarding flow
An onboarding cover and multiple onboarding step modals can be used in combination to create an oboarding flow.

```jsx
class MyCoolOnboardingFlow extends React.Component {
  constructor (props) {
    super(props)

    this.state = {
      currentModalIndex: 0
    }

    this.showNext = this.showNext.bind(this)
    this.showPrevious = this.showPrevious.bind(this)
    this.resetModal = this.resetModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)

    this.modalData = [
      {
        kind: 'onboardingCover',
        headingText: 'Cool new feature',
        primaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showNext}>Learn more</Button>,
        onboardingHeaderImage: <Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Cover+Image" alt="Meaningful alt text" />,
        children: (<Paragraph>Cover content</Paragraph>)
      },
      {
        kind: 'onboardingStep',
        headingText: 'Cool step 1',
        primaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showNext}>Next</Button>,
        secondaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showPrevious}>Previous</Button>,
        onboardingHeaderImage: <Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Step+1" alt="Meaningful alt text for step 1" />,
        children: (<Paragraph>Step 1 content</Paragraph>)
      },
      {
        kind: 'onboardingStep',
        headingText: 'Cool step 2',
        primaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showNext}>Next</Button>,
        secondaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showPrevious}>Previous</Button>,
        onboardingHeaderImage: <Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Step+2" alt="Meaningful alt text for step 2" />,
        children: (<Paragraph>Step 2 content</Paragraph>)
      },
      {
        kind: 'onboardingStep',
        headingText: 'Cool step 3',
        primaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.closeModal}>Done</Button>,
        secondaryActionButton: <Button onClick={this.showPrevious}>Previous</Button>,
        onboardingHeaderImage: <Image src="https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/4b81c9/ffffff?text=Step+3" alt="Meaningful alt text for step 3" />,
        children: (<Paragraph>Step 3 content</Paragraph>)
      }
    ]
  }

  showNext () {
    if (this.state.currentModalIndex <= this.modalData.length) {
      this.setState({ currentModalIndex: this.state.currentModalIndex + 1 })
    }
  }

  showPrevious () {
    this.state.currentModalIndex > 0 && this.setState({ currentModalIndex: this.state.currentModalIndex - 1 })
  }
  
  resetModal () {
    this.setState({ currentModalIndex: 0 })
  }
  
  closeModal () {
    this.props.handleCloseModal()
    setTimeout(() => {
      this.resetModal()
    }, 100)
  }

  render() {
    const modalProps = this.modalData[this.state.currentModalIndex]

    return (<Modal
      isOpen={this.props.isOpen}
      handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
      onboardingStepCurrent={this.state.currentModalIndex}
      onboardingStepTotal={this.modalData.length - 1}
      {...modalProps}
    />)
  }
}

class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <MyCoolOnboardingFlow isOpen={this.state.isOpen} handleCloseModal={this.closeModal} />
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

### A modal with an icon in the header
Optionally, a `headerIcon` can be provided to display an icon in the beginning of the modal heading
```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My base modal with an icon in header"
          headerIcon={IconGroceries}>
            <Paragraph>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Cursus metus aliquam eleifend mi in nulla posuere sollicitudin aliquam.</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Modal with media in content

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My modal"
        >
          <iframe width='450px' height='300px' src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5HiPsF06n4c?modestbranding=1&amp;rel=0&amp;enablejsapi=1" allowFullScreen className="min-w-full max-w-full"></iframe>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```

## Passing custom `data-` attributes to the modal
To add custom attributes, use the `data` prop, which should be an object whose keys are the attributes you want to set (without the leading `data-` prefix). For example, to add attribute `data-qa="test-modal"`, set `data={ { qa: "test-modal" } }`.

See [General Usage](http://reactcommunity.org/react-modal/#general-usage) section for more details about other props that you can pass to the modal content element.

```jsx
class ModalTrigger extends React.Component {
  constructor() {
    super(this.props)
    this.state = {
      isOpen: false
    }
    this.openModal = this.openModal.bind(this)
    this.closeModal = this.closeModal.bind(this)
    this.logAttributes = this.logAttributes.bind(this)
  }

  openModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: true }) }
  closeModal() { this.setState({ isOpen: false }) }
  logAttributes() {
    const element = window.document.getElementById('my-cool-modal')

    console.log('data-qa: ', element.getAttribute('data-qa'))
    console.log('data-somekey: ', element.getAttribute('data-somekey'))
  }

  render() {
    return (
      <>
        <Button onClick={this.openModal}>Open Modal</Button>
        <Modal
          id="my-cool-modal"
          isOpen={this.state.isOpen}
          kind="action"
          handleCloseModal={this.closeModal}
          headingText="My modal with custom props"
          data={{ qa: "test-modal", somekey: "some value" }}
          primaryActionButton={<Button onClick={this.logAttributes}>Log data attributes</Button>}
        >
          <Paragraph>...content</Paragraph>
        </Modal>
      </>
    )
  }
}

render(
  <ModalTrigger />
)
```
